entities

Class GamePlay

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • entities.GamePlay

  • public class GamePlay
extends java.util.Observable
    Observable Model for the Risk Game Contains Vectors of relevant class entities, such as continents, countries and players that has been created by the loadmap function from the controller Observed by the MapUI JLabels to update information on the current game status public methods within GamePlay is called by the controller while processing user inputs from the UI during game play Attributes can only be accessed by getters and setters from the controller handles change of game data and state and reflects to relevant observers

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GamePlay()
      Empty default ctor

      Used to determine the current running game is a part of a JUnit test Will disable Message Dialogues from popping up during the test runs by checking the is_test boolean
      void moveArmyTo(int number)
      Send army to the target country after the defender country lost all its armies If defender has lost all its countries, remove the defender from the game Moves phase to attack phase 1 or fortification depending on if the current player still can perform an attack
      void nextPlayer()
      Switches context to next player in chronological order Initiate reinforcement phase for that player
      void noAttack()
      From player command: -noattack During attack phase 1, player chooses not to attack any countries Goes directly into Fortification Phase
      void placeAll()
      From player command: placeall During startup phase, randomly places army on the map for all players until all players have no more units to place Enters Reinforcement phase once all troops are deployed Randomly places armies to current player's owned countries
      void placeArmy(Country c)
      From player command: placearmy countryname place one army to target country in parameter, then give the turn to the next player
      void populateCountries()
      Player input: populatecountries randomly assign ownership of countries on the map until all are filled

      From player command: reinforce country number During reinforcement phase, player assigns the input amount of army to target country

        From player command: placearmy countryname place one army to target country in parameter, then give the turn to the next player
        Parameters:
        c - Country to play an army

      • placeAll

        public void placeAll()
        From player command: placeall During startup phase, randomly places army on the map for all players until all players have no more units to place Enters Reinforcement phase once all troops are deployed Randomly places armies to current player's owned countries

      • startUpNext

        public void startUpNext()
        For next player to place army during Startup Phase Switches GamePlay context to next player's datasets

      • reinforceArmy

        public void reinforceArmy(Country c,
                          int num)
        From player command: reinforce country number During reinforcement phase, player assigns the input amount of army to target country
        Parameters:
        c - target countryId
        num - amount of army to assign

      • checkIfCanAttack

        public boolean checkIfCanAttack(Player p)
        Check if a player has at least one country able to attack 1. Country belongs to the player 2. Country has at least 2 armies 3. Country has at least 1 enemy neighbor
        Parameters:
        p - Player to test if can attack
        Returns:
        true if can false if not

      • noAttack

        public void noAttack()
        From player command: -noattack During attack phase 1, player chooses not to attack any countries Goes directly into Fortification Phase

      • setAttack

        public void setAttack(Country from,
                      Country to,
                      int dicenum)
        Set the attacker and the defender country for one round of attack Set the number of dice to be rolled by the attacker
        Parameters:
        from - Attacking country
        to - Defending country
        dicenum - Number of dice to be rolled by the attacking country

      • allOutAttack

        public boolean allOutAttack(Country from,
                            Country to)
        From player command: attack countryfrom countryto numdice -allout Commence a loop of attack rounds until one of the countries run out of army to attack/defend Always choose the maximum number of dice on both sides
        Parameters:
        from - Attacking Country
        to - Defending Country
        Returns:
        true if the Country is successfully conquered during the all out attack

      • commenceAttack

        public boolean commenceAttack(int defenderDice)
        Begins a round of attack after the defender has chosen the number of dice to be rolled
        Parameters:
        defenderDice - Number of dice to be rolled by the defender
        Returns:
        true if the Attacker successfully conquered the defending country

      • moveArmyTo

        public void moveArmyTo(int number)
        Send army to the target country after the defender country lost all its armies If defender has lost all its countries, remove the defender from the game Moves phase to attack phase 1 or fortification depending on if the current player still can perform an attack
        Parameters:
        number - Number of army to move

        Reset the owner for the defending country to the current owner after a successful conquer

      • checkIfCanFortify

        public boolean checkIfCanFortify(Player p)
        Checks if the current player has the ability to fortify units in the fortification phase
        Parameters:
        p - The player to check
        Returns:
        true if the player can fortify at least 1 country

      • fortify

        public void fortify(Country from,
                    Country to,
                    int num)
        From player command fortify fromcountry tocountry num removes army number from from country, add it to to country
        Parameters:
        from - Country mobilizing army
        to - Country receiving army
        num - Amount of army mobilized
